alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 11:04AM EDT until July 17 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Chesterfield, City of Richmond and Henrico Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Locks affecting City of Richmond and Henrico County. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Richmond Westham. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Approximately 20 acres of lowland flooded in vicinity of gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Monday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 6.1 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 03/18/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EDT.
